title: How to know if you are becoming more self-aware - Quora

response.answer_text: You can know it within the next five minutes. Turn your attention away from everything you are normally aware of - which is everything but you - and place your attention on you. Within a few minutes you should notice a difference from what you normally experience. If you are anxious, you will notice your anxiety is less. A sense of happiness enters, even though you are still feeling anxious. This is the realization that you are not your anxiety, or tension, or whatever else that troubles you, that you may be feeling right now. If you don't notice such a change it means only one thing: You are trying to observe a concept of yourself, which is a mental object. Self-awareness in my sense, not the dictionary sense, means to observe who is looking, who is feeling, who is thinking, who is experiencing everything. The dictionary version of self-awareness, which is not self-awareness at all, is to be aware of your personality or character. Talk about a fruitless exercise in self-defeat! That is self-absorption, not self-awareness. Your personality and character are both illusory, a passing show. Neither are you. Self-observation means awareness of yourself, the observer (subject), not the observed personality or character.

You will know you are becoming more self aware, when you begin to realize how little you actually “know” but take comfort in the certainty of ‘who you want to be” and pursue that concept to no end. With every interaction and every choice and every decision- you act in alignment with this concept of being “who you want to be” and come out feeling slightly more empowered each time. but the challenge is balancing the id and the ego when you start recognizing that you are becoming more self aware- which believe it or not is the same challenge presented a different way. Don’t get comfortable, bc there will always be challenges presented to strengthen you in your new alignment with self, or to weed you out back to the starting line. There is no finish line.

You know you’re becoming more self aware when: You can distinctively identify the emotion you’re feeling.What triggered the emotion.Your thoughts on the incident that triggered the emotion.The genesis of why the incident that triggered you made you feel the emotion.In the video below, I explain the value of self awareness and why an individual should invest in becoming more aware.  I hope you find this helpful.

You’ll know as you living life. All of a sudden you just begin to realize that you seem to be more aware of things, more often. Like you are more observant than you use to be. A person that is shy would be one example. They might seem quiet to people around them, but believe me; they are always observing.

You know you are becoming more self-aware when you start questioning your thoughts and your feelings and start laughing at some of the things you do, or say. Also, when you start living more in the outside world, instead of in your own head.

When you stop reacting to things that used to trigger you in the past. This means that you have processed much of your unconscious and subconscious. If you are having emotional outbursts, or you want to be emotional and have to fight to stop it, then there is still more work to do.
